poem:
Title: A Lament for Brightness Missed

Persistent, patient anthem's fate,
A tale of numbers, cold and chaste.
Songbird chirping at the gate,
In prosperity, no seat partake.
One hundred positions danced, amongst the great,
Yet pinnacle's embrace it did not taste.
In the shouts of weddings, spirit inflates;
In unechoed charts, a subtle waste.
The greatest tune without a date,
Echoes disappointment's bitter aftertaste.
